means: （一年之中的）重大事件（或重要日期）一览表

sentence.Network_en: Winners will be selected at the end of each calendar month.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个月末都会选出优胜者。

sentence.Network_en: They tried to make a calendar of Spain's festivals.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们打算做个西班牙节日活动一览表。

sentence.Network_en: It is one of the British sporting calendar's most prestigious events.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是英国体坛大事表上最负盛名的赛事之一。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French calendier, from Latin kalendarium 'account book', from kalendae (see calends)

entry.def: A calendar is a chart or device which displays the date and the day of the week, and often the whole of a particular year divided up into months, weeks, and days.

example.ex: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
example.tran: 上面的墙上挂着日历,日期上画着大大的方框。

entry.def: A calendar is a particular system for dividing time into periods such as years, months, and weeks, often starting from a particular point in history.

example.ex: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
example.tran: 公历最初是以罗马人的儒略历为基础制定的。

entry.tran: (某一组织、团体或个人的)日程表，纪事表，大事一览表
entry.def: You can use calendar to refer to a series or list of events and activities which take place on particular dates, and which are important for a particular organization, community, or person.

example.ex: It is one of the British sporting calendar's most prestigious events...
example.tran: 这是英国体坛大事表上最负盛名的赛事之一。

example.ex: Franklin joined her and the children whenever his crowded calendar allowed...
example.tran: 只要能从百忙之中抽出空,富兰克林就会陪在妻儿身边。

means.word_mean: 1. a system of timekeeping that defines the beginning and length and divisions of the year
2. a list or register of events (appointments or social events or court cases etc);

sentences.sentence: "I have you on my calendar for next Monday"

means.word_mean: 3. a tabular array of the days (usually for one year)

example.en: Okay, man, I'll see you in one calendar.
example.zh: 好吧，老兄，一个月后再见。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……的"; 2. 表名词,"人,物,器"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 线的,直线的,线状的;长度的;线性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: line线+ar……的→adj.线的,直线的,线状的;长度的;线性的
granul=grain颗粒+ar……的→adj.粒状的,含颗粒的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 核子的,原子能的,核的,中心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: nucle+ar……的→adj.核子的,原子能的,核的,中心的
peculi+ar……的→adj.奇特的,罕见的,特殊的
titul=title标题+ar……的→adj.有名无实的,名义上的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粗俗的,庸俗的,本土的,通俗的,普通的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vulg人群,平民+ar……的→adj.粗俗的,庸俗的,本土的,通俗的,普通的
alt高+ar人,物,器→高出的东西→祭坛

Sentence.sentence: Former George Washington University president Stephen Trachtenberg estimates that a typical college uses its facilities for academic purposes a little more than half the calendar year.

sentences.en: According to the calendar my birthday falls on a Sunday this year.
sentences.cn: 按照今年的日历, 我的生日恰好是个星期日。

sentences.en: The presidential elections are the highlight of next year's political calendar.
sentences.cn: 总统选举是明年政治日程表上的大事。

jushi.english: According to the university calendar your examinations will be in June.
jushi.chinese: 依照大学的行事历,你们的考试将在六月举行。

jushi.english: According to the calendar my birthday falls on a Sunday this year.
jushi.chinese: 按照今年的日历,我的生日恰好是个星期日。

jushi.english: The presidential elections are the highlight of next year's political calendar.
